org.mundo.service
Class DebugService

java.lang.Object
  org.mundo.rt.Service
      org.mundo.service.DebugService
All Implemented Interfaces:
IEmits
public class DebugService
extends Service

DebugService allows to inspect a node from remote. The cripple methods induce errors and can be used to test the fault tolerance.

Author:
Erwin Aitenbichler

Constructor Detail

DebugService

public DebugService()
Initializes a new debug service.

Method Detail

init

public void init()
Initializes the service. The service interface is connected to a channel with the name nodeId + ".DebugService", where nodeId is the string representation of this node's GUID.

Overrides:
init in class Service

shutdown

public void shutdown()
Description copied from class: Service
Shuts down the service. All subscriptions and advertisements are removed. If shutdown is overridden, this method must be called by means of super.shutdown (at the end) of the overriding method. In addition, a service's shutdown implementation must free all allocated system resources and terminate all custom threads.

Overrides:
shutdown in class Service

getERSImports

public java.util.List getERSImports()
Returns a list of Event Routing Service Imports. A channel is element of the import set if there exists a subscriber in this node that is subscribed to this channel.

Returns:
a List of ERSImportEntry objects.
See Also:
DebugService.ERSImportEntry

getERSExports

public java.util.List getERSExports()
Returns a list of Event Routing Service Exports. A channel is element of the export set if there exists a publisher in this node that publishes to that channel and there exists at least one subscriber to that channel on a remote node. For each element in the export set, the export list contains a tuple (ch, id), where id is the node identifier of the remote node hosting a subscriber to channel ch.

Returns:
a List of ERSExportEntry objects.
See Also:
DebugService.ERSExportEntry

crippleBlockSendsTo

public boolean crippleBlockSendsTo(GUID remoteId)
Cripples all IPTransportConnections to the specified node by blocking all send operations for twice the connection's timeout period. The response should be that MundoCore discards all faulty connections.

Parameters:
remoteId - the node ID which should become temporarily unreachable.
Returns:
true if at least one connection was found, or false otherwise.

addRawListener

public static void addRawListener(IReceiver receiver)
Registers a raw listener. A raw listener receives all messages received by the node at transport level. This mechanism is intended for debugging only.

removeRawListener

public static void removeRawListener(IReceiver receiver)
Unregisters a raw listener.
